max-sessions.description: The max sessions that netconf supports

absolute-timeout.description:
The max time of duration for a netconf session. 
 0 indicates the session will be online forever, unless the session is closed. The range of configuration is from 0 to 10000 minutes,the default value is 0 minutes;

idle-timeout.description:
The max idle time for a netconf session,
  0 indicates the session will not be closed by idle.The range of configuration is from 0 to 10000 minutes,the default value is 30 minutes;

sched-max-future.description:
The maximal difference between the scheduled time in the future 
and the present time that the server is willing to accept.

sched-max-past.description:
The maximal difference between the scheduled time in the past 
and the present time that the server is willing to accept.

sched-max-cache.description: Configure netconf max cache scheduled time RPC num

reply-info.description: Configure the elements carried in NETCONF rpc-reply.

status.description: Whether the NETCONF response message carries the <execution-time> element. When the server supports the time1.0 capability, but there is no <get-time> element in the request message.

operate-log.description: Configure NETCONF log function switch  parameters

status.description: Enable or disable NETCONF log function

get.description: Enable or disable log type of get function

set.description: Enable or disable log type of set function

operation.description: Enable or disable log type of operation function

sessions.description: The detail info of current active sessions

active-sessions.description: The number of current active sessions.

session.description: The detail info of an active session.

username.description: The username associated with this session.

ipaddress.description: The IP address associated with this session, it is the peer's IP address.

logintime.description:
The login time associated with this session, 
												             it is the time this session was established

replaysupport.description: whether to support historical event resend

conformance.description: The conformance-info of the yang modules defined by device.

modules.description: The modules info of yang defined by device.

features.description: The features info of yang module.

feature.description: The feature info of yang module.
